content.webTitle: Care fined and banned after pleading guilty to drink-driving

fields.headline: Care fined and banned after pleading guilty to drink-driving
fields.bodyText: Danny Care has been fined a total of £3,100 and banned from driving for 16 months after pleading guilty to drink-driving in the early hours of New Year's Day. The Harlequins scrum-half was stopped on the M3 motorway in Hampshire in the early hours, Southampton magistrates court heard. The incident led to the 25-year-old being excluded from England's Six Nations squad. It came three weeks after he had been fined by police for being drunk and disorderly. Hours before his arrest, Care tweeted: "2012 is hopefully going to be a massive year… Earn respect. Earn the shirt. Set the example." Quins fined Care £10,000 for the incident. PA
